title: Of Baptism
text: Baptism is not only a sign of profession, but a sign of Regeneration, or the new birth ... whereby ... they that receive Baptism rightly are grafted into the Church.
commentary: Article 27, “Of Baptism”, states: Baptism is not only a sign of profession, but a sign of Regeneration, or the new birth . The commentary below is a concise study essay offering historical context, theological significance, and suggestions for further study. Historically this Article reflects the Reformation effort to retain the catholic tradition where it is scriptural while rejecting practices viewed as unscriptural. For modern readers, note how this Article shapes worship, preaching, and ethical teaching, and compare it with patristic sources and later Anglican commentators.
